1.name: Das Cabinet des Dr. Caligari
1.description: Hypnotist Dr. Caligari uses a somnambulist, Cesare, to commit murders.

2.name: Der Golem, wie er in die Welt kam
2.description: In 16th-century Prague, a rabbi creates the Golem - a giant creature made of clay. Using sorcery, he brings the creature to life in order to protect the Jews of Prague from persecution.

3.name: Sex
3.description: A broadway actress uses her sex appeal to ruin a marriage only to dump her lover for a richer prospect.

4.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
4.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

5.name: Way Down East
5.description: A naive country girl is tricked into a sham marriage by a wealthy womanizer, then must rebuild her life despite the taint of having borne a child out of wedlock.

6.name: The Mark of Zorro
6.description: A seemingly idiotic fop is really the courageous vigilante Zorro, who seeks to protect the oppressed.

7.name: Anna Boleyn
7.description: The story of the ill-fated second wife of the English king Henry VIII, whose marriage to the Henry led to momentous political and religious turmoil in England.

8.name: Sumurun
8.description: The favorite slave girl of a tyrannical sheik falls in love with a cloth merchant. Meanwhile, a hunchback clown suffers unrequited love for a traveling dancer who wants to join the harem.

9.name: The Flapper
9.description: Ginger grows up in a slow town. Because of her wild attitude, her father decides to send her to a strict boarding school. Despite the strictness, the girls have fun getting into flapper lifestyle trouble including flirting.

10.name: The Penalty
10.description: A deformed criminal mastermind plans to loot the city of San Francisco as well as revenge himself on the doctor who mistakenly amputated his legs.

11.name: Why Change Your Wife?
11.description: Robert and Beth Gordon are married but share little. He runs into Sally at a cabaret and the Gordons are soon divorced. Just as he gets bored with Sally's superficiality, Beth strives to ...                See full summary »

12.name: The Last of the Mohicans
12.description: As Alice and Cora Munro attempt to find their father, a British officer in the French and Indian War, they are set upon by French soldiers and their cohorts, Huron tribesmen led by the evil...                See full summary »

13.name: Within Our Gates
13.description: Abandoned by her fiancé, an educated black woman with a shocking past dedicates herself to helping a near bankrupt school for impoverished black youths.

14.name: Shakuntala
14.description: Raja Dushyanta is out hunting in a nearby forest happens upon an attractive maiden, named Shakuntala, and instantly falls in love with her. He gives Shakuntala his ring as a symbol of his ...                See full summary »

15.name: Gyurkovicsarna
15.description: Film adaptation of the novel "A Gyurkovics-fiúk' by author Ferenc Herczeg, starring Gösta Ekman in the lead role, and featuring opera singer Emile Stiebel.

16.name: The Son of Tarzan
16.description: The scenario follows the book closely. Tarzan's son Jack (Korak to the apes) is kidnapped from England by Tarzan's old enemy Paulovich. He escapes into the African jungle with the help of ...                See full summary »

17.name: The Saphead
17.description: The simple-minded son of a rich financier must find his own way in the world.

18.name: Erotikon
18.description: EROTIKON surely pushed the boundaries of what was acceptable on the screen in 1920: Irene, the bored wife of a distracted entomologist, pursues a womanizing aviator, but she may actually be...                See full summary »

19.name: Pollyanna
19.description: An orphan's optimistic outlook brings a change to the ill-tempered town in which she resides to her aunt.

20.name: Terror Island
20.description: An inventor travels to the South Seas, where there is buried treasure belonging to a girl. The girl's father is being held captive by cannibals until she returns a pearl that belongs to one of their idols.

21.name: The Revenge of Tarzan
21.description: Tarzan and Jane are sailing for France in answer to a call for help from Countess de Coude who is being persecuted by her brother Rokoff. After a duel with the Countess' jealous husband, ...                See full summary »

22.name: Der Januskopf
22.description: See everything in the book "Conrad Veidt on Screen" by John T. Soister (McFarland 2002), pages 109-113.

23.name: The Man from Snowy River
23.description: A country boy, Jim Conroy, is living a dissolute life in the city, running around with vamp Helen Ross. When his father cuts him off, he is dumped by Helen and returns to the bush.

24.name: Huckleberry Finn
24.description: Huckleberry Finn, a rambuctious boy adventurer chafing under the bonds of civilization, escapes his humdrum world and his selfish, plotting father by sailing a raft down the Mississippi ...                See full summary »

25.name: Treasure Island
25.description: Young Jim Hawkins is caught up with the pirate Long John Silver in search of the buried treasure of the buccaneer Captain Flint, in this adaptation of the classic novel by Robert Louis ...                See full summary »

26.name: Der Bucklige und die Tänzerin
26.description: Wilton, a hunchback, who was always scorned and ridiculed by women, returns from Java a rich man after having discovered a diamond mine. He romances Gina, who is on the rebound from a ...                See full summary »

27.name: The Symbol of the Unconquered
27.description: Racists learn that the land a negro owns lies over a vast oil field, and threaten his life when he refuses to sell.

28.name: Das wandernde Bild
28.description: Mia May has surrendered herself to a disciple of free love, and, having given birth to a child, marries the twin brother and Doppelgänger of her chosen lover.

29.name: Die Spinnen, 2. Teil - Das Brillantenschiff
29.description: Kay Hoog wants to stop the organisation "Die Spinnen" to get a certain diamond, that will give the owning woman the crown of Asia, but the man, who should be the owner of that diamond, ...                See full summary »

30.name: Genuine
30.description: Extremely rare work of Robert Wiene. From the director and year of excellent "The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari" this work was eventually overshadowed by the success of Caligari. It has a dreamy atmosphere, like another world or something.

31.name: Blade af Satans bog
31.description: In 4 episodic tales of human suffering; the temptation of Jesus, the Spanish Inquisition, the French Revolution and the Russo-Finnish war of 1918, Satan attempts to win God's favor.

32.name: Prästänkan
32.description: A young man is elected by a small village to be its parson. As part of his duties, he is required to marry the widow of the parson before him. This poses two problems--first, the widow is ...                See full summary »

33.name: The Devil's Passkey
33.description: The wife of an American playwright in Paris becomes ensnared in the seductive wiles of an American Army officer, but her devotion to her husband convinces the officer to try to extricate ...                See full summary »

34.name: Outside the Law
34.description: In this early collaboration with director Tod Browning (Dracula, Freaks), Chaney delivers a dual performance of dramatic intensity, starring as Ah Wing, a kind-hearted student of Confucian ...                See full summary »

35.name: Humoresque
35.description: Young Leon Kanter dreams of being a great violinist. His parents scrape up the money for a violin and for lessons, and Leon rewards them by becoming a great player. But as an adult, Leon ...                See full summary »

36.name: Something to Think About
36.description: Wealthy cripple Markley finances the education of blacksmith's daughter Ruth. When she returns to their small town he asks to marry her, but she runs off with city worker Jim Dirk who is ...                See full summary »

38.name: Satanas
38.description: A three-part historical film, with episode one taking place in ancient Egypt, the second is based on the Hugo novel, and the third episode takes place during the 1917 Russian revolution.

39.name: Down on the Farm
39.description: The day starts off as any normal day on Roach's farm, where Teddy, the farmhouse dog, is doing more productive work than everyone else combined. But the day changes when Roach's farmhand ...                See full summary »

40.name: The Daughter of Dawn
40.description: This restored silent film features a love triangle involving a Kiowa chief's daughter and ensuing conflict between Kiowa and Comanche villages.

41.name: Something New
41.description: A young woman visiting in Mexico is kidnapped by a gang of bandits, who drag her through the rugged wilderness to their hideout. She manages to leave word for her friend Bill, who knows the...                See full summary »

42.name: Billions
42.description: Billions is a lost 1920 American silent comedy film produced by and starring Alla Nazimova and distributed by Metro Pictures. Ray Smallwood directed. It is based on a French play, L'Homme riche, by Jean Jose Frappa and Henry Dupuy-Mazuel.

46.name: L'homme du large
46.description: Nolff, a tough Breton fisherman is happy: his wife has just given birth to a son, Michel. His only wish is to make him a fisherman like him. But when he becomes a man, Michel becomes a ...                See full summary »

47.name: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
47.description: Dr. Henry Jekyll experiments with scientific means of revealing the hidden, dark side of man and releases a murderer from within himself.

48.name: The Toll Gate
48.description: After being betrayed to the law by one of his henchmen, a bandit leader seeks to avenge himself.

49.name: Headin' Home
49.description: The "true story" of baseball great Babe Ruth; Ruth plays himself.
